Hardware

getBatteryLevel View Source

Determines the approximate battery level.

Outputs

B

Battery level

Notes

This returns a value from 0-255. The precision of this value varies by calculator model. 6 MHz platforms will return a 0 or a 255. 15 MHz platforms will return 0, 63, 127, 191, or 255 (multiples of 64), where 0 is critical.

getIOLock View Source

Locks the I/O port to the current thread. Note that the I/O port can be used by several processes - it's usually best to leave it unlocked and let the kernel do your I/O.

getKeypadLock View Source

Locks the keyboard to the current thread.

getLcdLock View Source

Locks the LCD to the current thread.

getUSBLock View Source

Locks the USB port to the current thread.

hasIOLock View Source

Sets Z if the current thread has a lock on the I/O port.

hasKeypadLock View Source

Sets Z if the current thread has a lock on the keyboard.

hasLCDLock View Source

Sets Z if the current thread has a lock on the LCD.

hasUSBLock View Source

Sets Z if the current thread has a lock on the USB.

lcdDelay View Source

Blocks until the LCD is ready to receive data.
